net.pandoragames.far.ui.model

Class FileType

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.pandoragames.far.ui.model.FileType
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MimeType

    public class FileType
extends java.lang.Object
    Binds certain properties, such as encoding, to a category of files.
    Author:
    Olivier Wehner

      • TREAT_UNKNOWN_AS_BINARY

        public static boolean TREAT_UNKNOWN_AS_BINARY
        Should files of unknown mime type be treated as binary (or as plain text)?

      • fileTypes

        protected static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,FileType> fileTypes
        To be accessed by inheriting classes only.

      • FILE

        public static final FileType FILE
        The supertype of all file types. It's child types are TEXT and BINARY.

      • BINARY

        public static final FileType BINARY
        Supertype of all binary file types.

      • ARCHIVE

        public static final FileType ARCHIVE
        Binary file type for archives such as zip and tar.gz.

      • DOCUMENT

        public static final FileType DOCUMENT
        File type for binary documents such as PDF, odf and docx.

      • TEXT

        Supertype of all text file types.

        Tabular text data such as tab and csv.

        XML base type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileType

        public FileType(java.lang.String name,
        FileType parent)
        Every file type has a name. If parent is not specified, the file type will be a child of the common super type (FILE).
        Parameters:
        name - file type name
        parent - file type parent

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public static FileType getType(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the specified type by name if it does exist. The file type name is case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        name - file type name to look up
        Returns:
        file type or null

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the file type name.
        Returns:
        file type name

      • getParentType

        public FileType getParentType()
        Returns the parent type.
        Returns:
        parent type

      • setParentType

        public void setParentType(FileType newParent)
        Sets the specified FileType as new parent type of this type. Checks for null and circular dependencies.
        Parameters:
        newParent - to be set, must not be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if specified parent is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified parent is a descendant of this FileType

      • getCharacterset

        public java.nio.charset.Charset getCharacterset()
        Returns the associated character set. If no character set has been associated with this file type, the character set of the parent type will be returned.
        Returns:
        associated character set

      • setCharacterset

        public void setCharacterset(java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Defines the character set for this file type or removes the definition (if the parameter is null).
        Parameters:
        charset - to be associated with this file type or null.

      • isCharsetDefined

        public boolean isCharsetDefined()
        Returns true if the character set associate with this file type is specifically defined for this file type. Returns false if this file type uses the character set of its parent.
        Returns:
        true if associated character set is defined on this file type

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Two file types are considered equal if they have the same name.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
